cyclone.name: ERIN
cyclone.current_location: about 295 miles SE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northeast and accelerate well offshore, paralleling the U.S. East Coast toward Nova Scotia/Newfoundland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Newfoundland (as an extratropical or post-tropical system)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect — no U.S. coastal watches issued
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect — no U.S. coastal warnings issued
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Outer‐Atlantic waters from Cape Hatteras north-eastward toward Atlantic Canada; coastlines remain west of the cone
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible mid-week; chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds is very low (<5%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected — system remains far offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may drop 1–2 inches of rain Wednesday into Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and higher seas could affect harbor approaches and pilot boarding areas beginning late Tuesday, creating hazardous navigation for small craft
